citeinfo.origin: Earth Sciences Information Center, U.S. Geological Survey (USGS-ESIC)
citeinfo.title: USGS Digital Elevation Models 1:63,360

descript.abstract: Data Type: Elevation ; Digital Elevation Model (DEM) data consist of an array of regularly spaced elevations. DEM data in 15-minute units consist of regular arrays of elevations arranged horizontally to the coordinate system of NAD 27. The spacing between elevation along profiles is 2 arc seconds of latitude by 3 arc seconds of longitude. Each profile has 451 elevations. DEM data for 15-minute units correspond to the USGS 15-minute topographic quadrangle map series in Alaska. The unit sizes in Alaska vary depending on the latitude. Unit south of 59 degrees North cover 15x20-minute areas, those between 59 and 62 degrees North cover 15x22.5-minute areas.

idinfo.accconst: None. Indexes, price lists, and order forms available through ESIC-USGS. Data users guides are included with each order.
idinfo.useconst: None, request that USGS be noted as data source.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
